Content: A haul of 769 kilogrammes of cocaine was destroyed in public today under the supervision of President Mithriapala Srisena. The judicial process with respect to this haul of cocaine has been completed. The haul of cocaine was destroyed at the Suraweera Warehouse complex at Maguruwela in Kelaniya. The programme was put into action by the Police Narcotics Bureau on the orders of President Maithripala Sirisena. The narcotics were destroyed according to international standards. These huge hauls of cocaine were destroyed under the supervision of the Colombo Magistrate and the Mount Lavinia Chief Magistrate by converting it into a liquid. Officials of the Police Narcotics Bureau, the Dangerous Drugs Control Board and the Government Analyst Department were involved in it. Also the public were given an opportunity of witnessing the destruction process. The liquid will be transported under police protection in four tanks and would be vaporised at the Puttalam Cement Factory under high temperatures. The 301 kilogrammes of cocaine recovered from the Orugodawatte container yard in 2016, the 31 kilogrammes recovered from the Pethiyagoda in Kelaniya and the 219 kilogrammes recovered from the Orugodawatte Customs Yard were destroyed in this manner. Expressing his views on the occasion President Maithripala Sirisena pointed out that the programme mooted to root out illegal drugs racket is now being carried out on a very successful note.
